info.name: Hummii API - With Test Scenarios
info.description:
Complete API collection for Hummii platform with automated test scenarios

Features:
- üéØ **Test Scenarios** - Run complete user flows in one click
- üîÑ Automated variable management
- ‚úÖ Built-in test assertions
- üìä Comprehensive coverage
- üìß Email verification testing

**Quick Start:**
1. Select environment: 'Hummii API - Local'
2. Go to 'Test Scenarios' folder
3. Right-click any scenario ‚Üí 'Run folder'
4. Watch tests execute automatically

**Available Scenarios:**
- Complete User Journey (Registration ‚Üí Email Verification ‚Üí Login ‚Üí Profile)
- Email Verification Flow (Register ‚Üí Verify ‚Üí Login)
- Order Lifecycle (Create ‚Üí Publish ‚Üí Proposal ‚Üí Accept ‚Üí Complete)
- Contractor Setup (Profile ‚Üí Portfolio ‚Üí Subscription)
- Subscription Management (Create ‚Üí Upgrade ‚Üí Downgrade ‚Üí Cancel)
- Review System (Order ‚Üí Complete ‚Üí Review ‚Üí Response)
- Dispute Flow (Create ‚Üí Evidence ‚Üí Messages ‚Üí Resolution)
- Chat Flow (Send ‚Üí Edit ‚Üí Mark Read ‚Üí Export)
- Notifications Flow (Get ‚Üí Mark Read ‚Üí Preferences)
- Security & Error Handling (Unauthorized, Validation, etc.)

**Note on Email Verification:**
For email verification tests, you need to manually obtain the verification token from:
1. Email inbox (if email service is configured)
2. Database query: `SELECT verificationToken FROM users WHERE email = 'test@example.com'`
3. API logs

Set the `verification_token` environment variable before running verification steps.

All existing individual endpoints are preserved in their original folders.

item.name: üéØ Test Scenarios
item.description: Complete test scenarios that can be run in one click. Each scenario is a series of related API calls that test a complete user flow.

item.name: üöÄ Quick Health Check
item.description: Quick validation that API is running and responding correctly

item.name: üë§ Complete User Journey
item.description: Full user registration ‚Üí email verification ‚Üí login ‚Üí profile update flow. Run this to test the complete authentication cycle.

exec: console.log('‚ö†Ô∏è  Note: Check email for verification token or use test token');
// In real scenario, you would get this token from email
// For testing, you need to either:
// 1. Check your email inbox for the token
// 3. Use a test/mock token if in dev environment
console.log('üìß Note: Use verification token from email or database');

request.description: Verify email using token sent to user's email. In testing, you need to manually set the verification_token variable with the token from email or database.

exec: console.log('üéâ Complete User Journey - ALL TESTS PASSED!');

item.name: ÔøΩ Email Verification Flow
item.description: Test email verification: Register ‚Üí Get verification token ‚Üí Verify ‚Üí Login as verified user

exec: console.log('‚ö†Ô∏è  Email verification required. Check email for token.');
// Note: Depending on your API logic, this might succeed but with limited access
// or fail completely. Adjust the test based on your implementation.
// Check if login is blocked or allowed with limitations
console.log('‚úÖ Step 2: Pre-verification login attempt - PASSED');

request.description: Try to login before email verification. Behavior depends on API implementation.

exec: // IMPORTANT: You need to manually set 'verification_token' variable
// 1. Email inbox (if email service is configured)
// 2. Database: SELECT verificationToken FROM users WHERE email = '...'
console.log('   Set verification_token variable with token from email/database');
console.log('   Database query: SELECT verificationToken FROM users WHERE email = "' + pm.environment.get('verification_test_email') + '"');

query.description: Token from email - must be set manually

request.description: Verify email using the token. You must manually set the 'verification_token' environment variable with the token from email or database.
